name: Jaipuri Lac Bangles
description: Handcrafted by Jaipur's legendary artisans using centuries-old techniques
longDescription: Bring home more than just bangles — bring home a piece of India's soul. Handcrafted by Jaipur's legendary artisans, our Jaipuri Lac Bangles are a timeless blend of vibrant tradition and modern elegance.

name: Jaipuri Safa
description: Traditional Rajasthani headgear with deep cultural roots
longDescription: Turn heads, honor heritage, and become a part of royal tradition with the iconic Jaipuri Safa. Handcrafted in the heart of Rajasthan using luxurious chunri fabric, zari, cotton, and silk.

name: Jaipur Blue Pottery
description: GI-Tagged craft with iconic cobalt blue and Mughal patterns
longDescription: Bring home more than just decor — bring home legacy, art, and a story that lasts generations. Made using a rare, ancient blend of glass, Multani Matti, quartz, borax & Katira Gond.
artisan: Master Gopal Saini - National Award winner

name: Himalayan Sea Buckthorn
longDescription: Harvested from the high-altitude valleys of Lahaul-Spiti and Ladakh, Sea Buckthorn is a natural powerhouse with Omega 3-6-7-9, Vitamin C, Vitamin E, and over 190 bioactive compounds.

name: Kangra Tea
description: GI-tagged heritage brew with mellow flavor and delicate fragrance
longDescription: Born in the pristine valleys of Palampur and Dharamshala, this tea carries forward a story that began in 1849. Milder than Darjeeling with naturally sweet and floral character.

name: Shahi Jeera (Black Cumin)
description: Himalayan heritage in every seed, grown above 8000ft
longDescription: Hand-harvested by women-led SHGs and dried on warm stones, every seed reflects generations of tradition. Grown wild in mineral-rich, non-industrial soils above 8,000 ft.

name: Makka Leaf Tokari
description: Handwoven heritage basket from maize husks
longDescription: Made by rural women artisans using sun-dried maize husks in village courtyards. Zero plastic, zero chemicals, fully biodegradable with traditional weaving techniques.

name: Himalayan Walnuts (Akhrot)
description: Naturally grown, handpicked from high-altitude orchards
longDescription: Hand-harvested by small orchard farmers using traditional methods. Available in big (gifting quality) and small (high oil content) varieties. No artificial polish or additives.

name: Chamba Mirch
longDescription: Sun-dried for 12-15 days on stone courtyards, delivering distinct smoky-earthy flavor and deep crimson glow. Medium-to-high heat with authentic Pahadi character.

name: Brash ke Phool
description: Wild Himalayan blossom for wellness and ritual
longDescription: Hand-collected from sacred forest belts, this wild golden blossom has been used for spiritual calm and healing. Brewed as tea for nerve calming or burned as natural incense.

name: Sepu Badi
description: Handcrafted lentil dumplings from mountain kitchens
longDescription: Traditional Himachali heritage made from urad dal, naturally spiced and sun-dried. Perfect for authentic Sepu Madra curry or as crispy snacks. Stone-ground without machines.

name: Barote & Kinorri Rajma
description: Himalayan heirloom beans with rich aroma
longDescription: Grown in serene valleys with glacier-fed waters and clean mountain air. Cooks faster than regular rajma with naturally creamy texture and earthy flavor requiring minimal spices.

name: Walnut Shells (Akhrot ke Chilke)
description: Nature's own hair and skin remedy
longDescription: Sun-dried walnut shells from high-altitude forests, traditionally used for natural hair dye and skin exfoliation. Creates rich brown hue when mixed with henna, chemical-free beauty solution.

name: Kangra Herbal Organic Tea
description: Culture in a cup - wellness blends from tea valleys
longDescription: Hand-harvested from Kangra and Palampur slopes, blended with Tulsi, Ginger, Chamomile, Rose, Mint, and Lemongrass. Each variant offers specific wellness benefits from digestive relief to relaxation.

name: Jaipuri Gudari
description: Heritage quilt with Kantha stitching and Rajasthani prints
longDescription: Hand-stitched using Kantha techniques with upcycled cotton and azo-free colors. Lightweight yet warm, featuring signature Rajasthani patterns. Each piece is unique artisan creation.
